content.text: Complete the frequency table
You may use the tally column to help you
Draw a bar chart to show this information
Complete the scale on the frequency axis
One day, Lena records the drinks she sells in one hour
Tea Tea Coffee Juice Milkshake Milkshake Coffee Coffee
Milkshake Coffee Tea Juice Tea Coffee Tea Juice
Milkshake Tea Milkshake Tea Coffee Tea Milkshake Coffee
Work out the total number of hours the café is open in one week
Lena is in the café for 40 hours each week
Ron is in the café when Lena is not there
Calculate the percentage of the total opening hours that Ron is in the café each week
This table shows the opening hours of the café

table.html:
DayOpening hours
Monday to Thursday08:30 to 17:00
Friday and Saturday08:30 to 19:00
Sunday09:00 to 18:00

content.text: Saddak buys 3 cups of tea and 2 cookies for \$6.95
A cup of tea costs \$1.75
Work out the cost of one cookie
The price of a cake is \$2.60
At the end of the day, Lena reduces the price of each cake by \(35\%\)
Calculate the reduced price of a cake
Lena owns a café
Write down all the factors of 18
Write down a prime number between 40 and 50
Give your answer correct to 1 decimal place
Find the value of
Find the value of \(k\)
Write 90 as the product of its prime factors
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 90 and 126

Write the ratio number of males : number of females
Give your answer in its simplest form
One of these visitors is selected at random
Find the probability that this visitor is a male child
The table gives some information about the numbers of visitors at a leisure centre one day
Write down the mode
Calculate the mean
The number of people in each of 150 cars entering the leisure centre car park is recorded. The table shows the results
In a survey of 50 visitors to the leisure centre, 18 used the gym
One day, 1500 people visited the leisure centre
Calculate an estimate for the number of people who used the gym on this day

Use your graph to solve the equation \(\quad x^{2} - 5x = 3\)

and

Nora has a packet containing \(250\mathrm{g}\) of cherries
She uses \(\frac{7}{10}\) of the cherries in the cake

Calculate the length of this ribbon

The radius of the large cylinder is \(15\mathrm{cm}\)
The radius of the small cylinder is \(8\mathrm{cm}\)
The height of each cylinder is \(10\mathrm{cm}\)
